items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Use one Entra tenant for managing your Azure resources, unless you have a clear regulatory or business requirement for multi-tenants.

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Ensure you have a Multi-Tenant Automation approach to managing your Microsoft Entra ID Tenants

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Leverage Azure Lighthouse for Multi-Tenant Management

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Ensure that Azure Lighthouse is used for administering the tenant by partner

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Discuss support request and escalation process with CSP partner

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Setup Cost Reporting and Views with Azure Cost Management

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Configure Notification Contacts to a group mailbox

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Use departments and accounts to map your organization's structure to your enrollment hierarchy which can help with separating billing.

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Enable both DA View Charges and AO View Charges on your EA Enrollments to allow users with the correct perms review Cost and Billing Data.

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Make use of Enterprise Dev/Test Subscriptions to reduce costs for non-production workloads

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Configure Agreement billing account notification contact email

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Use Billing Profiles and Invoice sections to structure your agreements billing for effective cost management

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Make use of Microsoft Azure plan for dev/test offer to reduce costs for non-production workloads

items.category: Azure Billing and Microsoft Entra ID Tenants
items.text: Periodically audit the agreement billing RBAC role assignments to review who has access to your MCA billing account

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Enforce a RBAC model that aligns to your cloud operating model. Scope and Assign across Management Groups and Subscriptions.

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.subcategory: Microsoft Entra ID and Hybrid Identity
items.text: Use managed identities instead of service principals for authentication to Azure services. You can check for existing service principals via Entra ID > Sign in Logs > Service principal logins.

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Only use the authentication type Work or school account for all account types. Avoid using the Microsoft account

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Only use groups to assign permissions. Add on-premises groups to the Entra ID only group if a group management system is already in place.

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Enforce Microsoft Entra ID conditional-access policies for any user with rights to Azure environments

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Enforce multi-factor authentication for any user with rights to the Azure environments

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Enforce centralized and delegated responsibilities to manage resources deployed inside the landing zone, based on role and security requirements

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Enforce Microsoft Entra ID Privileged Identity Management (PIM) to establish zero standing access and least privilege

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: When deploying Active Directory on Windows Server, use a location with Availability Zones and deploy at least two VMs across these zones. If not available, deploy in an Availability Set

items.category: Identity and Access Management
items.text: Use Azure custom RBAC roles for the following key roles to provide fine-grain access across your ALZ: Azure platform owner, network management, security operations, subscription owner, application owner. Align these roles to teams and responsibilities within your business.
